intro: Scleria levis var. scaberrima, commonly known as the rough-stemmed sedges, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its stiff, ribbed stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its inflorescence consists of a spike of small, three-lobed flowers, typically green or brown in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks.
